I think it's this.

Fractal Design Makes a handful of cases with sound deadener preinstalled, Zalman also makes a nice Passive cooler. Most of your noise will come from the GPU and case fans. There are ways to get a build pretty darn quiet, I would say 15-30 Decibels would be quiet enough for someone to not notice when you add in background noise.

Let us not forget the design the Fractals are based on, the Antec P-series. The P180, P183 and now P280 are very nice, large, silent cases. The P180 was even designed together with the lads from Silent PC Review.

I built my system to be as quiet as possible, as I became a bit allergic to sound after having a very noisy Pentium 4 machine and my workload is primarily workstation oriented - so no game noises to hide the sound of the computer. The first time I turned it on I thought I messed it up, because I heard nothing, but it just is that quiet. The key is to choose parts without too much energy output (easy with CPU's nowadays, as even high-end chips are frugal, you have to be a bit more careful when it comes to the GPU) combined with LARGE heatsinks. I use a royal fancontrolled sprinkling of Nexus Real Silent fans to top it off. Most are turned off (but nice to have on a hot summer day), a few spin at low speeds.

The only downside is that buying something new like a GPU will always carry an extra penalty in the shape of an after market cooler, as even the cards with fancy coolers are way, way too noisy.

And honestly, i'm not finding a lot of data either way, this guy with his GT630 is the ONLY account i have of anyone playing with a card like this, here or on reddit, and whatever benchmarks i can find suggest the geforces are at least 5 times faster then my current GPU.

I would recommend getting a card that you know will do what you want. At this price level a little extra money means a lot more performance. You can hardly go wrong by spending a little bit more for a card you know will perform. And of course, if it ends up being a disappointment, fixing that mistake will cost even more money.

As a somewhat useless reference, I play KSP with a GTS 450 and it is typically only 25% loaded at the highest settings and 1600x1200, although I am very CPU limited because of the mods I run (even though I have a fairly beefy CPU).

Hello! When installing a motherboard should I put spacers between it and the case?

Yes, those are more important than most people realize. Always install them!
